panels.description: The first visual change is when something for the first time is painted within the current viewport. It is calculated by analyzing a video recording of the screen.
panels.title: First Visual Change

panels.description: The Speed Index is the average time at which visible parts of the page are displayed. It is expressed in milliseconds and dependent on size of the view port. It was created by Pat Meenan and you can checkout the full documentation [here](https://sites.google.com/a/webpagetest.org/docs/using-webpagetest/metrics/speed-index).
panels.title: Speed Index

panels.description: The last visual change is when something for the last time is changing within the current viewport. It is calculated by analyzing a video recording of the screen.
panels.title: Last Visual Change

panels.description: Fully loaded time when the last of all assets is downloaded on the page. It is calculated using the Resource Timing API where we use the last downloaded asset.
panels.title: Fully loaded

panels.description: The  $function backend time is the  $function time it takes for the network and the server to generate and start sending the HTML for all the analyzed pages. It is collected using the Navigation Timing API taking the responseStart minus navigationStart.
panels.title: Backend time

panels.description: The frontend $function time is the time it takes for the browser to parse and create the page.  It is collected using the Navigation Timing API by taking the loadEventStart minus responseEnd.
panels.title: Frontend time

panels.description: The $function number of requests for all the analyzed pages.
panels.title: Requests

panels.description: The $function number of CSS requests for all the analyzed pages.
panels.title: CSS requests

panels.description: The $function number of JavaScript requests for all the analyzed pages.
panels.title: JavaScript requests

panels.description: The $function number of image requests for all the analyzed pages.
panels.title: Image requests

panels.description: The $function number of domains used for all the analyzed pages.
panels.title: Domains

panels.description: The $function value for the response expire time of all assets. Compare this with the $function last modified $function value to understand how good you configured the cache settings on your site.
panels.title: Response expire time

panels.description: The $function value for the last modified time of all assets. Compare this with the $function cache time to know how smart you have configured the cache settings.
panels.title: Last modified time

panels.description: The $function transfer size over the wire of all images on all analyzed page.
panels.title: Images transfer size

panels.description: The $function total transfer size over the wire (compressed size if your asset is compressed) of all assets on a page.
panels.title: Total transfer size

panels.description: The $function total score from the [Coach](https://www.sitespeed.io/documentation/coach/) for all tested pages.
panels.title: Coach score

panels.description: The $function performance score from the [Coach](https://www.sitespeed.io/documentation/coach/) for all tested pages.
panels.title: Performance score

panels.description: The size of the largest image on all the analyzed pages.
panels.title: Largest image size

panels.description: [Navigation Timing API](https://www.w3.org/TR/navigation-timing/) metrics.
panels.title: Summary Navigation Timings [$function]

panels.description:
The max time spent in frontend vs backend time. 

The backend time is the time it takes for the network and the server to generate and start sending the HTML. It is collected using the Navigation Timing API taking the responseStart minus navigationStart.

The frontend time is the time it takes for the browser to parse and create the page.  It is collected using the Navigation Timing API by taking the loadEventStart minus responseEnd.
panels.title: Time spent in backend vs frontend [$function]

panels.description:
The $function transfer size of all your first party responses.  

The first party content (content you serve your self ) are defined by the requests that  match the regexp you supply with the parameter *--firstParty*
panels.title: First party size

panels.description:
The $function transfer size of all your third party responses.  

The third party content (content other companies/organizations serve like advertisement, social media buttons etc) are defined by the requests that doesn't match the regexp you supply with the parameter *--firstParty*
panels.title: Third party size

panels.description:
The $function number of requests for all your first party responses.  

The first party content (content you serve your self ) are defined by the requests that match the regexp you supply with the parameter *--firstParty*
panels.title: First party requests

panels.description:
The $function number of requests for all your third party responses.  

The third party content (content other companies/organizations serve like advertisement, social media buttons etc) are defined by the requests that doesn't match the regexp you supply with the parameter *--firstParty*
panels.title: Third party requests

panels.description: The $function total size over the wire for all assets served for this page.
panels.title: Total transfer size

panels.description: The $function total size for all assets served for this page. This includes the uncompressed size for compressed text/css/html/js/font content.
panels.title: Total content size

panels.description: The $function total size over the wire for all stylesheet assets served for this page.
panels.title: Total CSS transfer size

panels.description: The $function total size for stylesheets assets served for this page. This includes the uncompressed size of CSS responses.
panels.title: Total CSS content size

panels.description: The $function total size over the wire for all Javascript assets served for this page.
panels.title: Total JS transfer size

panels.description: The $function total size for Javascripts assets served for this page. This includes the uncompressed size of JS responses.
panels.title: Total JS content size

panels.description: The $function total size over the wire for all HTML served for this page.
panels.title: Total HTML transfer size

panels.description: The $function total size for HTML served for this page. This includes the uncompressed size of HTML responses.
panels.title: Total HTML content size

panels.description: The $function total size over the wire for all font responses served for this page.
panels.title: Total font transfer size

panels.description: The $function total size for font responses served for this page. This includes the uncompressed size of font responses.
panels.title: Total font content size

panels.description: The $function total size over the wire for all image responses served for this page.
panels.title: Total image size

panels.description: The $function total size over the wire for all SVG responses served for this page.
panels.title: Total SVG  transfer size

rows.title: Chrome show transfer vs content size. Firefox only transfer size.  [$function]
